95e15399-d255-4fa9-b4e7-34c65e3ca7f9.description: The recipient of this badge can define the business need that drives projects and evaluate project complexity so as to choose the right type of project and associated project management methodologies. This earner uses best practices of project teamwork and communication and is able to manage risk and react effectively in the face of the unexpected.

c66ffae3-abf8-47e3-a195-14a42634aff8.description: The recipient of this badge has completed the Human Resource Management certificate program at the Center for Executive & Professional Education. Upon completion of this program, students are able to: understand the philosophy and function of the HR discipline; become familiar with laws that protect employees: Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA), and the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and 1991; understand and define the role of compensation and benefits.
c66ffae3-abf8-47e3-a195-14a42634aff8.name: Human Resource Management

issuer.summary: issued by Center for Executive and Professional Education

entity.name: Center for Executive and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The individual has completed 6 courses within the Human Resource Management certificate program. Four required courses: Management of Human Resources; Employment Law and Regulations; Business Acumen; Total Rewards, plus 2 of the following electives: Talent Acquisition, Selection, and Retention; Effective Training Design and Evaluation; Strategic Leadership and Influence; Change Management & Conflict Resolution; Finance for HR Professionals.

9553505d-e4ca-4191-a484-3d75fd65de55.description: The recipient of this badge understands key concepts of business analysis. 906ef851-eb2a-445c-af84-8adb11990a23.description: The recipient of this badge is able to develop a digital marketing strategy. 20d33d9b-ff09-43d6-b58f-4bbafe79a584.description: The recipient of this badge knows the principles, methodologies, and tools that are essential to create a culture of continuous, sustained improvement. This earner is able to be an agent of sustainable change needed to increase efficiency, reduce waste, and maximize business value.

One additional elective is required from: Six Sigma Fundamentals; Lean Healthcare; Inventory Management; Lean Business Processes

f0d19872-f1cf-4103-a6ea-eac4660a8b82.description: The recipient of this badge can define and apply key ideas in the field of strategic communications and build a well-developed strategic PR plan. This earner can also identify key aspects of crisis communications planning.

7ade655d-ae7f-49d5-8095-fa6309fc182d.description: The recipient of this badge has completed the Business of Craft Brewing certificate program at the Center for Executive & Professional Education. Upon completion of this program, students are able to: implement a fully actionable business plan, create an operations and distribution plan, develop a marketing and sales strategy; understand regulation and compliance issues, and are familiar with best practices for tasting/taprooms.

76add616-782c-40bc-9dc9-b0ab77d0599f.description: The earner of this badge has completed the Change Management certificate program. Upon completion of this program, students are able to: define & understand the components of the data life cycle and big data; understand the basics of database management & design concepts; describe data in a meaningful way with charts and statistics; become familiar with the wide range of applications of data mining and common data mining processes.
